Question: Helen Adams **** (June 27, 1880 – June 1, 1968) was an American author, political activist, and lecturer.
Hints: This person is credited with having introduced the Akita to the United States through these two dogs.
She progressed to working as a secretary as well, and eventually became a constant companion to this person.
Starting in May 1888, this person attended the Perkins Institute for the Blind.
